replies.body: Apparently Froggen Shook and Tabzz are part of Fnatic.  Looks like someone didn't proofread.
This is a bad typo by yours truly. Shame is brought upon my house.
TSM better than Fnatic and SK? The 2 best team in europe after Alliance? if tsm wins a single game at worlds ill be very surprised.
It's hardly the same team as before. The fact they managed to step their game up by a HUGE margin speaks of at least a 4-4 score.
LOL at your comment. Where all all of you're EU teams?
EU people wont reply now wont they.. coz they ate all their  JOKE statements lmfao
i don't see any in the quarterfinals...i quess they all went home.
LMQ is so behind. All that hate
I love Lmq but honestly they have a very high chance of getting trashed all over the place{{item:3070}}

I agree, i love their style butto many other regions know how o ork against it or do it themselves and are just slightly better, HOWEVER, if xiaoweixiao gets yasuo/ vasilii gets trist things can get sour really fast.
Why is Alliance so far above other western teams? The difference between them and Fnatic were 2 wins in the regular season and 3-1 in the play-offs. That doesn't deserve 5 spots difference.
their win against fnatic at playoffs was really convincing. they seem to be a class above all the other western teams
True, I'm a total fan of Fnatic be i have to admit that Alliance is out of their league at the moment. Maybe another year playing with an analyst will spice up their power.
White shield above edg and alliance? REALLY?
i mean they did beat skt t1 k....
So did a lot of other teams too this season.  Skt t1 k didn't look like they care to win this season..

Which non korean team did SKT T1 K get beat by? Thats right. None. Also they only lost to Samsung White, KT Arrows and Najin Shield. Top 4 team in Korea. I don't count that as a lot of teams beating SKT t1 K

Because I disagree with these power rankings I want to do one for myself
1. White
2. Blue
3. EDG
4. Shield
5. OMG
6. SHRC
7. ALL
8. C9
9. Fnc
10. TPA
11. TSM
12. LMQ
13. SK
14 .AHQ
15. KABUM
16. DP

IMO You rate OMG too high - I've watched LPL this season and they weren't dominant, clearly worse than SHRC. I Even think they should be swiched with Alliance.

And don't underestimate the power of rotations and perfect banpick phase from SK.
I am here from future to tell you taht OMG 3: 0 NWS
Shield show the capability to beat the top OGN teams including the former champion, I doubt EDG can do that, all Korean teams are the best teams coming to worlds.
why korea won s3: midlane carry meta, faker was bets midlaner in the world  why korea isnt gonna dominate everything s4: adc meta, best adc are found in china

Have you even seen LPL? Their play is so haphazard with terrible objective control. The difference between top players are so small that it doesn't really matter. Also, Chinese supports are clearly behind Korean supports by a mile as far as vision control goes. You can't win with mechanics alone anymore
This meta is ADC based, but Koreans are still the best at carrying with a team, so this still puts them ahead of the rest ( i don't know how much )

I completely disagree, I've watched all the LPL and OGN games over the last two months and to say that OGN is going to come totally dominate is an overstatment. EDG has been taking games off all the top Korean teams in scrims, and I'm sorry there isn't an bot lane in Korea that can beat out NaMei and Fzzf or Uzi and Zero. 

That being said I feel Star Horn and EDG are going to have a tough time of it to beat out the Korean teams. But I think top five is 1. Samsung Blue 2. EDG 3. Samsung White 4. Najin White 5. Starhorn. But all these teams I feel can take down one another. (though star horn is the weakest of them all and I don't see taking down blue unless Uzi just straight up dismantles them bot lane which is really doubtful, blue is just to good.) 

Though its clearly a Chinese and Korean worlds this year, its going to be exciting to watch to see how EDG stacks up vs White in the first match of worlds, and arguably the best match we are going to see for the first week!

You really think that EDG is better than White? Lol. They are sloppy in comparison and way less well rounded. I also think that you have forgotten about Imp and the world's best support, Mata, aka 'the new god.'

Much better.
Id bump OMG to 8th, switch TSM and TPQ, and switch AHQ and KUBUM.

Much closer than Riot's thoughts tho

Pretty much. Although, based on performance at regionals, I'd argue that SK should be on par with Fnatic - if anything, they looked stronger in their set against Alliance than Fnatic did in theirs.

Agree with pretty much everything else, though. Good list.

Two teams I see underrated in this list are TSM and Fnatic. I know that realistically TSM shoudn't end up anywhere near the top, but I think they have a great chance of getting out of the groups.
So, second team - Fnatic. That is the team, that can do bad all split, then get their shit together for playoffs and after that, simply show up their best at worlds. If this isn't going to be different from the past years, I think fnatic will overcome OMG, expecially with Toyz on their side.
And the last thing.. I really don't think that someone should have any doubt about the top three teams in this tournament - NJWS, Samsung White and Samsung Blue. Only thing I disagree with in this list between these teams is that Blue wins instead of White.. I think white is pretty much a better team only because their team is literally like a all-star team, but actually with great teamwork in it. My guess is White first, NJWS second and 3rd/4th - Blue/EDG.
Also as a TSM fan, feeling for them because if they get out of groups, then the only team they will lose to will be Star Horn.. So if they finish second they will most likely have to play against Samsung White in the quarterfinals.

>So, second team - Fnatic. That is the team, that can do bad all split, then get their shit together for playoffs

Until they don't. Fnatic looked decidedly uninspiring at the European regionals - based only on their performance there, I'd say that they're the third best team coming from Europe this year. Maybe they will get it together like they used to, but we've seen our first glimpse of a Fnatic that *can't* show up when it really matters, and I worry that that's the same team we'll see at worlds.
Fnatic did step up at the end, it's just not so noticable because Alliance did step up even more. At least that's my opinion

If Fnatic is falling behind the best teams in their own region, how much can we expect of them on an international stage? SK looked better in their loss to Alliance than Fnatic did in theirs, and a lot of people are predicting SK won't be able to get out of the only group without a Korean team.

I believe sure the South Korean teams did probably get better With the NA scene season 1 they thought they were the kings season 2 they realized they werent and tried to get competitive, but didnt really have anyone to raise the bar for them. Season 3 cloud 9 stepped in and stomped the competition giving a higher bar set for them that they could test themselves on. Season 4 the best of the weaker teams split off and joined the other teams making not just a top2-3 and forget everyone else but now every team had a chance. Plus newcomer LMQ worked their way up and was another top competitor. From week one it was hard to say who was going to be the top 3 and who were gonna be the bottom 3. Every team looked so much better and cloud 9 staying the same wasnt the lone powerhouse. This made every match count and I would guess even raised the standards of cloud 9. That is why I believe NA jumped up much more compared to Korea because korea has always had that every match is a hard one NA is just now getting it. There is another reason but that is getting a bit technical.

I honestly have no idea where this idea of "The Korean were already the best so they didn't improve as much as everyone else" came from.  It's not like the Korean teams slowed down and took it easy. SKT1K didn't even make it to Worlds, they got knocked off their perch by other teams that improved and worked hard.

The Korean bias in this article is hilariously intense. Samsung didn't get out of groups last year.

Yes, Najin Black Sword was 3rd and SKT was 1st, but other regions have improved a hell of a lot more than Korea has because they had more room to improve than Korea did.

Blind hype for Korea over other regions without having seen them compete against each other yet is just foolish, especially when Alliance/TSM/C9/Fnatic/SHRC/OMG/EDG are all strong teams. Its especially insulting to have NJWS over EDG/Alliance/TSM/C9/Fnatic/OMG. NJWS had a good run in playoffs, but their regular season simply doesn't back up their ability to play at that level consistently.

And, let's not forget, Samsung was hyped as one of the favorites to win last year, one of the "top three teams in the tournament" and didn't even leave groups. Finished in the bottom half of the tournament. Blinding worshiping/hyping/bandwagoning Korea has got to be one of the most foolish things I've seen in a long time.

CLG thought that Korea and copying them was the end all, be all... And it got them knocked out of the play-offs in grand fashion by NA teams that didn't know what they were gonna do. They brought over Korean strats... that didn't work. They practiced with "the best teams in the world!" and couldn't beat the 4th/5th best teams in NA after 3 weeks of that.

They're strong teams, with good players. But Korea has won exactly ONE of the world championships so far. Of the two times that Korean teams have managed to get to finals, they have a 1-1 record.

They're good, and Samsung Blue or White are both great choices to win, but only an idiot would think that the third best team in Korea is decisively better than the best teams in EU/NA/China.

CLG's problem was not gameplay/strategy wise, but tilting/negative team athmosphere, the reason the bootcamp was done in korea, was because seraph had to renew his visa.

Could i remmind to you All-stars, SKT 1 K was not at all the best team in korea then, and isn't now, but they walked over their ccompetition. It is true, Fnatic wasn't really prepared c9 had link and such, but i fthey had, and the best korean team was there,  the non korean teams would'nt have had a chance. 

Last year, Ozone was not the 3rd best korean team, and sword was not the 2nd best at that time, and still sword barely lost to skt k 2-3, after wich skt k stomped the opposition in the finals. 

Reggarding your comment on NJWS, only EDG was consistent throughout their season, All sllumped a bit i the middle of the season, TSM only won consistent agaisnt bottom teams, C9 had more losses in this season then in their previous two combined. Fntc is alsmot nover consistent in the regular seasons and OMG has been slumping at the end. So the only team you could make a case for is EDG.

So yeah, the hype isn't really blind...

And last  year Ozone got literally stomped by Fnatic, and lost to Gambit, who, in all honesty, didn't look even half as good as everyone expected them to. Seriously, you don't see a pattern here? Korean teams play well against each other, EU teams play well against each other and NA teams starting this season are also playing well against each other. The thing is - they're scrimming against themselves, so they know what to expect and how to play against their region tactics. Also some team tactics may be achilles' heel for others. Royal Club got destroyed by SKT in the finals last year, because their "protect the puppy" strategy doesn't work against most korean teams. Yes, right now it's speculations from my side, but I believe that both OMG and Fnatic would do much better against SKT in the finals, even though Royal won against both Fnatic and OMG.
"Last year" is no longer relevant.

> but I believe that both OMG and Fnatic would do much better against SKT in the finals, even though Royal won against both Fnatic and OMG.


Lol Fnatic. The team that got stomped by Royal would have done better against SKT? Only in the wildest EU fanboy dreams. Yellowstar even admitted in an interview that SKT would have stomped them.
it's a rock, paper, scissors. You can't say OMG Paper beat Rock, and Rock beat Scissors so Paper can beat Scissors too!
So you're going on blind hope that Fnatic had a better match up against SKT last year than Royal. Fair enough, maybe Fnatic might have done better against SKT than Royal Club.

You are forgetting, every single champ that Dade plays got nerfed. They also decided to get a new top laner right before worlds. Yea... The signs of Samsung Ozone doing horrible was there. What signs do you see right now?
Even all star cant tell anything...

well first off I kinda agree with you about the korean bias.. but you made an incorrect point about samsung not getting out of group stage last year. And why thats incorrect is because Korea plays with Circuit points and Samsung won their first circuit tournament (early S3) while it was in favour of Dade's meta with ryze mid and ori and stuff like that. As the season went on, it shifted towards the assassin mid meta and we all know who that favoured.. players like bjerg, faker, shiphtur excelled in that playstyle. So since Samsung won the first circuit, they had enough points to automatically qualify for worlds even tho they lost the summer and regional tournament going into worlds. So in fact dade was playing on a cahmp pool that he was very uncomfortable with. 

And now back to this year, just like last year.. SKT won the first circuit tournament (spring) in Korea which gave them the 500 points, but because the other teams had more points they were unable to make it. and in regionals this year SKT fell to other teams such as the samsung teams as well as NJS. And youre wandering why? Well atm u can see that even in the NA/EU scene, Ori and Ryze mids have come back into play. Gragas is no longer playable at mid. Zed is still viable but not as popular anymore compared to yasuo. teams started coming out with poke comps like using ziggs and Xerath and these are all NOT champs that we know faker for. We know him for his high mechanical plays on ahri, gragas and Zed. and of the 3, only 1 is still viable atm.

Um...there are plenty of cases you could make for meta shifts hurting individual players...this isn't one of them.  Faker, outside of the tilting against Pawn, has been effectively 1v9ing every game.  His teammates are slumping, incredibly hard(meta shift probably had influence here) but outside of the crummy slumping situation, Faker has continued to be incredibly strong.

I would say 2v8, if anything. Although it can be hard to notice, Piglet has been performing rather consistently through all of the SKT slumping. It's not surprising at all considering he is the "practice worm", but bot lane is a constant 2v2.

What have Alliance/TSM/C9/FATIC/SHRC/OMG/EDG done to deserve higher place than Najin White Shield. I can understand EDG but the rest are far below Najin White Shield. Alliance is overhyped coming into Worlds and TSM/C9/Fnatic/SHRC/OMG has done nothing to prove that they are better than the top 3 Korean teams. What happened last year was an unfortunate event of Samsung's head coach leaving as well as sudden patch change nerfing Dade's champion pool. That's why Riot no longer do sudden patch changes and let players adapt before the patch takes place. Also, Najin White Shield beat SKT T1K which destroyed Fnatic, C9, OMG, TPA at All Stars and KTB went undefeated during IEM. That's why they placed the Korean teams at top 3. Also, yes there is a chance of a Korean team just tilting as what happened last year however for that to happen it's a small chance. For example, Samsung had to go through those 2 changes JUST for them to make it to top 3 of their group. You argue other regions improved. Korea wasn't jerking off and did nothing to improve themselves. They also improved at a big rate. Right now Koreans are forced to improve all the time because teams are getting hungrier in OGN. The skill gap in Korea itself is decreasing and more teams are reaching to become top tier teams. So while NA/EU are growing at a slower pace due to lack of competition Korea is growing further and faster due to more competition.

All this post can be shortened to "I'm riding korean dicks". Fnatic have shown many  times, that on a big stage they can never be counted out. White shield have 0 international experience, while both Wickd and Froggen are one of the most experienced players in the world, when it comes to performing internationally. C9 also seem to be doing better and better with every international tournament they participate in. It doesn't matter, that a few months ago SKT beat Fnatic, because NWS weren't able to beat SKT back then (Fnatic beat TPA twice, as well as Azubu Frost just 2 months after s2 championship ended, and Fnatic didn't even qualify for s2 championship), and one good run during regionals doesn't mean much (take last year and Mineski, who were by far worse than AHQ for example, yet  they qualified, simply cause they had a great run). This is a world championship, where everything's on the line. If you have no experience on a big stage then you probably won't be able to deal with all the pressure, and it's very easy to go on tilt. And as for last year's Ozone's performance, don't look for excuses like "nerfing Dade's champion pool", because A. it didn't happen 2 days before worlds started (and at that time basically all midlaners were playing assasins, yet they were able to adapt to the patch), and B. Dade isn't and never was the corpse of the team. Entire Ozone performed poorly, and it's very possible it's gonna happen again.

You can't use no international experience as an excuse. Najin White Shield have played in front of thousands at OGN Spring. Alliance as a team doesn't have international experience as well only as individual players who ended up getting stomped at Worlds. Also you don't know nothing about OGN, Najin Shield never played against SKT until regionals. We'll see at Worlds and the only person that you are embarrassing is yourself
When was it that Wickd and Froggen got stomped at worlds? When they took 3/4?
